Description: Landscape with the Rest on the Flight into Egypt, study connected with the painting; view between trees, a bridge in the foreground, various ruins including a pyramid, a river or coast bordered by hills in the distance. 1660 Pen and brown ink, brown wash Verso: Two sketches of a head Pen and brown ink
Curator's comments: This drawing corresponds to the painting of the Landscape with the Rest on the Flight to Egypt that Claude produced in 1661 for van Hamale (for which see Roethlisberger 1962, no. 257) and which is recorded in the Liber Veritatis at No. 154 (for which see 1957,1214.160). It is one of a number of preliminary drawings for this painting (for another see Oo,7.135). The present drawing records the completed landscape, albeit in reverse. This method of working out the setting prior to the addition of the figures was used by Claude across his career. He does however appear to have started to draw in the figure of the Virgin the lower right corner. There are two small characterful sketches of faces on the verso that appear to have been made on a whim. Lit.: A.M. Hind, 'Catalogue of the Drawings of Claude Lorrain preserved in the Department of Prints and Drawings', London, 1926, no. 254; M. Roethlisberger, 'Claude Lorrain: The drawings catalog', 2 vols, Berkeley and Los Angeles, 1968, no. 853.
